step_feedback.feedback: Good job bringing your arms in front of your chest and making fists while inhaling and tightening muscles.  Ensure consistent fist closure throughout the inhalation phase for optimal muscle engagement.

While the arm extension is good, focus on a smoother exhale and muscle relaxation as you extend your arms horizontally. The slight inconsistencies in elbow and wrist movement between repetitions suggest a need for more controlled relaxation.

The range of motion in the arm extension needs improvement.  Try to extend your arms fully to shoulder height while maintaining a controlled movement.  Inconsistent wrist movement between repetitions needs attention.

The coordination between arm movement and breathing could be improved.  Ensure a complete exhale during arm extension.  The right wrist shows more variation than the left, focus on maintaining even movement in both wrists.

The final repetition shows some improvement, but maintaining consistent muscle engagement and relaxation throughout the exercise is key.  Focus on smoother transitions between the arm movements and breathing.

exercise_summary: The patient demonstrated understanding of the Horizontal Pumping exercise.  While the initial arm-in phase was executed well, the arm extension phase and coordination with breathing require further refinement.  Consistency in wrist and elbow movement across repetitions needs improvement.  Focus on controlled movements and smooth transitions between inhalation and exhalation.
